intro: Gladiolus caeruleus, commonly known as the blue gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are borne in dense spikes and are known for their vibrant color and long-lasting bloom. The botanical features of Gladiolus caeruleus make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and floral arrangements.
